sen.j: 竹田大徳（たけだのだいとく、たけだのだいとこ、生没年不詳）は、日本の飛鳥時代の人物である。
sen.e: TAKEDA no Daitoku (date of birth and death unknown) lived in the Asuka period in Japan.
TAKEDA no Daitoku (or TAKEDA no Daitoko, date of birth and death unknown) lived during Japan's Asuka period.
sen.cmt: 「たけだのだいとこ」の表記を追加しました。
sen.e: TAKEDA no Daitoku (or TAKEDA no Daitoko, date of birth and death unknown) lived during Japan's Asuka period.

sen.j: 旧仮名遣いでの読みは「たけだのだいとく」または「だいとこ」で同じ。
sen.e: In old Japanese syllabary characters, his name was also pronounced as "TAKEDA no Daitoku" or "TAKEDA no Daitoko".
In the old Japanese kana syllabary, too, his name was pronounced as "TAKEDA no Daitoku" or "TAKEDA no Daitoko."
sen.cmt: 「同じ」を分かりやすくしました。
sen.e: In the old Japanese kana syllabary, too, his name was pronounced as "TAKEDA no Daitoku" or "TAKEDA no Daitoko."
No hereditary title was given.
He did not hold a hereditary title.
sen.cmt: 他ファイルのネイティブチェックを参考に修正しました。
sen.e: He did not hold a hereditary title.

sen.j: 672年の壬申の乱で大海人皇子（天武天皇）側の高市皇子に従って都を脱した。
sen.e: He escaped from the capital following Prince Takechi who supported Prince Oama (Emperor Tenmu) in the Jinshin War in 672.
He escaped from the capital following Prince Takechi who supported Prince Oama (Emperor Tenmu) in the Jinshin War of 672.
sen.cmt: 余分なスペースを削除しました。
sen.e: He escaped from the capital following Prince Takechi who supported Prince Oama (Emperor Tenmu) in the Jinshin War of 672.

sen.j: 古代に竹田氏は複数知られており、大徳の出自は不明である。
sen.e: Since there were multiple Takeda clans in ancient times, Daitoku's place of origin is unknown.
Since there were multiple Takeda clans in ancient times, Daitoku's place of origin is unknown.
Since there were multiple Takeda clans in ancient times, Daitoku's place of origin is unknown.

sen.j: 壬申の乱が勃発したとき、竹田大徳は近江国の近江宮にいたらしい。
sen.e: When the Jinshin War started, TAKEDA no Daitoku was in Omi no miya in Omi province.
When the Jinshin War started, TAKEDA no Daitoku was in Omi no miya in Omi Province.
When the Jinshin War started, TAKEDA no Daitoku was in Omi no miya in Omi Province.

sen.j: 大津京にいた高市皇子は、父の大海人皇子の挙兵を知って京を脱出し、6月25日に鹿深を越えて積殖山口で大海人皇子の一行に合流した。
sen.e: Prince Takechi escaped from the capital after he discovered that his father (Prince Oama) had taken up arms, got over Kafuka and joined Prince Oama's party at Tsumue yamaguchi on June 25.
Prince Takechi escaped from the capital after he discovered that his father (Prince Oama) had taken up arms, got over Kafuka and joined Prince Oama's party at Tsumue yamaguchi on June 25.
Prince Takechi escaped from the capital after he discovered that his father (Prince Oama) had taken up arms, got over Kafuka and joined Prince Oama's party at Tsumue yamaguchi on June 25.

sen.j: このとき高市皇子に従っていたのが、民大火、赤染徳足、大蔵広隅、坂上国麻呂、古市黒麻呂、竹田大徳、胆香瓦安倍であった。
sen.e: Prince Takechi's followers at this time were TAMI no Ohi, AKASOME no Tokotari, OKURA no Hirosumi, SAKANOUE noKunimaro, FURUICHI no Kuromaro and TAKEDA no Daitoku and IKAGO no Ahe.

sen.cmt: andをひとつ削除しました。

sen.j: 鹿深は近江国甲賀郡のあたりである。
sen.e: Kafuka is located around Koga gun, Omi Province.

sen.j: 積殖は、後の伊賀国阿拝郡柘植郷（現在の伊賀市柘植）と推定され、当時は伊勢国に属した。
sen.e: It is believed that Tsumue was later Tsuge county, Ae country, Iga province (Current Tsuge, Iga city) and was a part of Ise province.
It is believed that Tsumue yamaguchi was later Tsuge-go, Ae County, Iga Province (current Tsuge, Iga City) and belonged to Ise Province at that time.
sen.cmt: 原文通りTsumune にyamaguchiを追記し、柘植郷をTsuge-goとしました。
sen.e: It is believed that Tsumue yamaguchi was later Tsuge-go, Ae County, Iga Province (current Tsuge, Iga City) and belonged to Ise Province at that time.

sen.j: 大徳のその後の行動については記録がない。
sen.e: No records were kept of Daitoku's later acts.
There is no record of the rest of Daitoku's life.
sen.cmt: わかりにくいので修正しました。
sen.e: There is no record of the rest of Daitoku's life.
